```{r}
# Read in downloaded EPA data for Arizona 
az_epa_data <- read_csv("/Users/oana/Documents/github/duke_datafest_covid19/datasets/downloaded_epa_data_04142020.csv") 


datatable(head(az_epa_data))
```

From [this site](covid19.healthdata.org), California's stay at home order was March 19th, 2020. So, let's look at data from then: 

```{r}
CA_stay_at_home_start_date <- as.Date("03/19/20")
today <- as.Date("04/14/20") # you can do this automatically, but I forget how

mydates <- interval(start = CA_stay_at_home_start_date, end = today)

az_epa_data %>% 
  filter(Date %within% mydates)
```
